website_summaries.verdict: A recipe book that makes the keto diet accessible and cost-effective.
pros: Customers appreciate that with just a few ingredients per recipe, dishes are tasty and vary from day to day
We love the simplicity of each recipe and the confidence each instills to help readers believe the diet is achievable without sacrificing taste
cons: Not written for foodies who are looking for sophisticated recipes

customer_reviews.title: i thought it would be easy peasy for cooking during the hectic work week
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book because it had “5 ingredients” in the title.i thought it would be easy peasy for cooking during the hectic work week. The recipes are pretty easy but most required more than 5 ingredients which is irritating since the name is “Easy 5 ingredients...”
customer_reviews.author: K. Banholzer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Title and Requires Specialty Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: The name of this book is misleading. Very few of the recipes contain five or less ingredients. The author also includes specialty ingredients such as “Perfect Keto Exogenous Ketone Powder in Peaches and Cream”. I was expecting ingredients that I could purchase at my local grocery store.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: I Wanted to love this. The high net carb levels are ridiculously ...
customer_reviews.text: I Wanted to love this. The high net carb levels are ridiculously high for each portion (like 13 and 15!!) which completely defeats keto!! Beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Best Life-Changing Decision I’ve EVER made!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this book 6 stars, I would. Jen somehow made my transition to Keto the easiest, and BEST thing I’ve ever done for myself. My family gobbles up her meals with no leftovers to spare! Don’t waste a second trying to decide. BUY. THIS. BOOK.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Snyder

customer_reviews.title: My new one stop for Keto food prep
customer_reviews.text: This book has it all! The recipes and ingredients are simple and accessible, and I actually want to eat just about everything in here. I’m following a strict Keto profile (20g of total carbs a day) and I can eat many of the recipes here; however there are a large handful that have too many carbs for me at this point. If you are doing net 20g or even moderate Keto just about everything should be right on track for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting very simple, enjoyable recipes and ended up with expensive and time consuming ones. I’m a little disappointed in this book as I heard it has such great reviews. Not to mention most are more than 5 imgredients.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra B- Real Ass Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of simple, tasty recipes with ingredients (if you are doing keto) that you probably already have on hand. A lot of the recipes do have more than 5 ingredients, but those are usually salt and pepper, butter. Normal cupboard, fridge items. LOVE the pancake recipe and the peanut butter cookie recipe. Anybody should be able to find recipes that you can get on the table in a short time. Pretty sure this cookbook, will be a favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Lilpup

customer_reviews.title: Misleading in multiple ways.
customer_reviews.text: This book is misleading in multiple ways. First, every recipe in this book requires more than 5 ingredients. In fact, in the very first chapter the author lists 16 different ingredients needed as 'staples' for the recipes contained in the book. These staples are NOT included in the 5-ingredient count of the recipes. And most of these staples are highly specialized, not readily available at the corner grocery store. Moreover, many of the actual five ingredients in the book are specialized as well and no commonly available. After trying find the ingredients required and get used to this book for almost a month, I'm returning it today.
customer_reviews.author: Owen B. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: the title lies ... very VERY few recipes with 5 ingredients
customer_reviews.text: WHAT? The title lies. After the bulletproof coffee, the first recipe has 7 ingredients, then 7 again, finally the next has 5, then 8, 8, 8, 8, 8, 8, 7, 9, 8, and so on, and so forth. Based on that alone what a sham this cookbook is. I will be returning it. Mind as well just get a regular keto cookbook. This is nothing special or above and beyond any other cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Cedar Grove Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Keto made easy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Can the ketogenic diet get any easier?! The Easy 5 Ingredient Keto cookbook by @ketointhecity_ is definitely made for busy peeps; I made these tasty avocado egg salad lettuce cups in less than half hour and they were amazing!!! If you’re busy and/or if you’re new to keto, I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: @lowcarbdelights

customer_reviews.title: NO recipe photos -
customer_reviews.text: You know the saying "we eat with our eyes first" I like to see what the meal will look like and so many of the Keto cookbooks have wonderful photos, NOT this one. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: SwissnevaTop Contributor: Ukuleles

customer_reviews.title: Net Carbs may not be correct.
customer_reviews.text: The book is nice enough looking, and most of the recipes have correct Net Carbs, but make sure you read through them and do the math yourself. Especially in the sweets. The net carbs are off in many of them.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Many great recipes in this book!!
customer_reviews.text: The recipes in this book are so delicious. Also, I see that people are getting confused about the "5-ingredient" part in the title. There's obviously more than 5 ingredients needed. Each recipe has its 5 main ingredients, not 5 ingredients total in the book. My favorites are the jalapeno bacon egg cups, shrimp and avocado salad, and the Parmesan baked chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No recipe pictures
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to receive this cookbook but was very disappointed because there are no pictures of the actual recipes, just my personal preference to see a picture of the recipe before I cook it. The quality of the book was good but disappointed with no recipe pictures. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have for keto!
customer_reviews.text: WONDERFUL!!! The recipes are easy to follow and with only 5 ingredients I have most of them on hand and can throw a good meal together quickly.

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes - great book
customer_reviews.text: I’ve made several recipes from this book and so far they’ve all been delicious and simple. I also appreciate the diet overview at the beginning - very informative.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cook book! It provides a ton of information about the Keto lifestyle as well as a HUGE amount of recipes! For sure recommend to newbie Keto eaters like myself.
customer_reviews.author: christina bond

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time. Recipes are boring and you would do better getting Maria Emmerich's cook books.
customer_reviews.author: Be

customer_reviews.title: Book is largely an advertisement for high-priced specialty Keto products
customer_reviews.text: This book reads like an advertisement for many specialty products market to Keto tonic dieters. For example, recipes have some ingredients identified by brand name and others generically. In fairness, if one is that busy they cannot be bothered to select a brand of ghee in their own, then perhaps this book will appeal to them with certain brand names clearly featured. I did not see any mention of consideration provided in exchange for the product promotion.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Raymond

customer_reviews.title: So very disappointed. It uses so many specific brands that are ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked up this book because a magazine article showed a few recipes with simple ingredients and then bought it because of reviews. So very disappointed. It uses so many specific brands that are either expensive or not for sale near me. In addition no real ideas of substitutions for those ingredients. Just a commercial for certain brands.
customer_reviews.author: Eliz

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just confused as to how there are no recipes that actually have only 5 ingredients
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: I love this book
customer_reviews.text: Here are photos I took of the recipes I made from this cook book. I love this cook book so much I plan on buying three more to give as Christmas gifts. The best thing about this book is that it is easy to follow and it only requires 5 ingredients or less.
customer_reviews.author: Keto Alice

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like it I love to cook, but this cook book is hard to read. All the recepies are so difficult to follow I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronny

customer_reviews.title: Too many carbs
customer_reviews.text: I just started Keto and wanted a cookbook to give me a variety of recipes. However, this book has way too many fish and avocado dishes. And the carb counts are too much for me (yogurt, chia seeds and carrots on the cover of the book) I would return it but it was only $10.
customer_reviews.author: Noname

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this book but once I opened it, was highly disappointed. No pictures and the recipes are not for people who already know how to cook. I made the Sesame Pork with Green Beans and apologized for serving it.
customer_reviews.author: MissKate

customer_reviews.title: Recipes are not complete.
customer_reviews.text: Recipes do not tell you how many ounces of meat to use! Also these recipes are very high in calories so for an average person they take up most of your calorie intake for the day for a dinner recipe. I’m sending it back!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Not for those new to Keto
customer_reviews.text: The recipes in the book are easy enough but be aware it does not include a meal plan. If you are new to Keto this is not the book for you. It will give you great food but without a plan to figure out the right combination of meals its virtually worthless. The key to Keto is the right combination of fats-carbs-proteins. While loved the recipes in this book I had to order another one which provided a meal plan. If you have been doing Keto for awhile and have your macros figured out this book is perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Hopeful

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow directions and minimal ingredients... LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook! All of the recipes are very easy to follow and I love that there is only 5 ingredients or less for each recipe. The tips in the bottom of each recipe really help diversify the way each recipe can be made. My favorite recipe is the cream cheese muffins -- I add approx 1/3 cup of sweetener and chopped jalapeno to make it taste more like a corn bread. It is AMAZING! I definitely recommend this book... and for the price...UNBEATABLE!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Covarrubias

customer_reviews.title: Very few photos
customer_reviews.text: I like to see before what I am cooking. Am very disappointed this has very few photos of the foods.
customer_reviews.author: M Long

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Title - Recipes are NOT only five ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this recipe book. I ordered in hopes of getting "5-Ingredient Ketogenic" recipes. Unfortunately, this is not what this book contains. The title is a lie. All recipes require 1-5 "main" ingredients IN ADDITION to up to 5 other ingredients. So most recipes have 8-10 ingredients. The "main" ingredients required are salt, pepper, ghee, olive oil, and butter. If you're looking for a generic ketogenic cookbook, this will probably be fine, but if you're truly looking for "Easy 5-ingredient" recipes, this is NOT the book for you. I gave it two stars because there is some solid information in the opening pages.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Some recipes are still pretty high in carbs which is odd to me
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of recipes that I wouldn't really want in my keto diet. Some recipes are still pretty high in carbs which is odd to me. It's all right for cheap. Not going to be my go to cookbook for keto.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow. Not 5 ingredient receipts. Not a lot of variety in recipes either.
customer_reviews.author: Mama bear

customer_reviews.title: which I love (bought it first
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the same book as 'The One-Pot Ketogenic Diet Cookbook' by Liz Williams, which I love (bought it first.) This book is just a different cover and listed as written by a different author (until you open the book up, and by golly, there it shows Liz Williams did author it!) So I wasted ten bucks plus shipping and handling. Buy one or the other.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic ideas but watch out for legume and nightshade ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Some of these recipes are not totally Keto and some are expensive to make. I wish the layout were a bit easier to work through to find the dish I want to cook but maybe I'm being picky. I think I'm a tad more fond of the BulletProof Diet recipes so I'll mostly use the Meat and Veg dishes in this book. Some tasty ideas though so still worth the buy. LOVE the "mashed potatoes" made from cauliflower.
customer_reviews.author: M.J.

customer_reviews.title: First recipe I tried was inedible
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of simple cooking with only five ingredients. My first recipe was Mississippi Pot Roast, which uses a slow cooked, one pound chuck roast to serve 4. The recipe included a one-ounce packet each of Ranch dressing and au jus gravy. The resulting pot roast was so salty that it was inedible. I checked the sodium content on packets and it turns out that each of the four 4-ounce servings would include 1,140 grams of sodium ( and that doesn’t include the salt that the recipe calls for to season the meat). I will try another recipe since I already bought the book but so far I’m just disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: L Nostrant

customer_reviews.title: The basic info on Keto is good.
customer_reviews.text: This book is okay but the recipes seem to be high in calories and I wasn't expecting that. The basic info on Keto is good.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Not 5 ingredient Recipes & recipes just aren’t good
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, the title is misleading. Almost all the recipes require more than 5 ingredients. I have tried 5-6 recipes from the book now and I have yet to follow a recipe where I don’t have to do a lot to ‘fix’ it. The broccoli cheese soup, for example. It was like water with a cheesy flavor and some broccoli. I had to add xantham gum and more salt. Anyway...wasn’t worth it to me. I’m donating it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING and EASY recipes
customer_reviews.text: This is not only my favorite keto cookbook, it is my favorite cookbook ever! The recipes are super easy to make and are delicious. They have completely transformed me into a low-carb healthy eating expert. I am most impressed with the desserts. The peanut butter and berry cheesecake fat bombs are as easy as melting ingredients in a microwave and then freezing for a few hours. And WOW! are they delicious. I prefer swerve to stevia (even though its super expensive), but it is so worth it. I think I like this food better than what I was eating before starting keto. Definitely a winner. P.S. I have 3 other keto books and this one hands down is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Mandaz

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Not really impressed with the recipes. I didn’t see in the description that all the meals serve just 2. That’s not a big deal because it isn’t hard to remedy that. I was looking for something with more family friendly recipes. This one doesn’t provide many meals my kids (ages 5-15) would eat. Plus some of the ingredients aren’t easy for me to find in our community. Sad it isn’t the one for us but I’m keeping the book. It does have a few things I want to try and will make for my weekly lunches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Really basic book with recipes anyone knows how to make without a recipe, such as quesadillas for example. Sad I wasted $10 on this.
customer_reviews.author: Kaci Mchale

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: Many recipes have ingredients that are NOT KETO approved. Read carefully and find ones that are true keto. Hate for someone to miss ketosis because they trusted the recipes only.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this book for Keto/weightloss
customer_reviews.text: I find this book to barely borderline a true keto diet. Many of the recipes fall between 7-12 grams of carbs per serving which IMO is kind of high considering most people eat at least 3 meals a day and you MUST keep your carb intake under 20 grams to maintain ketosis. Also, most people do keto for weight loss. This book has many recipes that are 700+ calories per meal not making it ideal for a calorie deficit on a 3+ meal a day plan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS COOKBOOK! *10 STARS*
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this cookbook 10 stars I would! Being new to Keto, I was having a hard time finding easy recipes for two people. Most Keto cookbooks call for tons of ingredients that can become overwhelming when putting together your shopping list. The things I love most about this book are the recipes are delicious, the ingredients are simple, and each recipe is designed for two servings. I also love the “substitute” section under each recipe. Thank you so much, Jen Fisch, for putting the joy back into cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 Ingredients Keto Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Great book for getting started on a Keto lifestyle. Very simple recipes, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to follow!
customer_reviews.text: Super simple and tasty things to try! I got into a Keto rut of eating the same thing over and over and this was a great way to have more variety without being overwhelming. Taco soup is delish!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Dolph

customer_reviews.title: Easy recipes that taste great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cookbook to have if your on the ketogenic diet. Included in this book are some keto guidelines and foods to use and foods to avoid. Great for beginners! The recipes are simple and do not require a lot of ingredients nor a lot of time to prepare.
customer_reviews.author: Doxie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow with great keto recipes
customer_reviews.text: I just received the book and I am quite disappointed in the grammar errors and the incomplete sentences. For example(s), on page IV the word of was placed on two separate lines and on page 4 the author made a statement but never finished the last sentence which left me hanging. As I'm continuing my reading I noticed that the incomplete sentence was finished on page 6. Outside of the errors the book seems like something I would love to try and maintain.
customer_reviews.author: monique wynn

customer_reviews.title: Wing recipe is a game changer
customer_reviews.text: Just picked up this book a few days ago & have tried out 3 recipes so far. I just came here to say that the slow cooker garlic Parmesan chicken wings were absolutely amazing. I doubled the recipe ingredients, but used 4x the amount of wings. It was a little hard to accommodate all that in the slow cooker so some tweaking will need to be done on my part, but the flavor & smell was out of this world. Threw them on the grill for a little char after they were done & they were still falling off the bone. Can’t wait to try the rest of the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Madaline Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very boring. Meals a simple mind can throw together with no thought and without paying for a book. Clean eating does not involve gravy mixes, tortillas, diet drinks and salad dressing mixes.
customer_reviews.author: This game stinks my son complained about it all night

customer_reviews.title: For our purposes this was PERFECT -- Worthy of 6 stars!
customer_reviews.text: First, the title is misleading -- Many recipes do have more than 5 ingredients. However, 5 ingredients wasn't key to what I was looking for. I was preparing to teach a Nutritional Kitchen course to non-keto teens. I wanted clear and easy instructions. I wanted tasty food. I wanted things we could prepare within an hour. I wanted real food that they could repeat at home. I wanted to introduce them to low carb diets and options like interval fasting. Teens and parents are THRILLED with the results! Their teens are excited to be able to come home and cook real meals successfully, and understand the benefits of reducing carbs in their diet.
customer_reviews.author: B Family Shopper

customer_reviews.title: MUST LOVE COOKING
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is well made and easy to read. Also will open flat without pages falling out. However, this is for those who love to cook and have a very large grocery budget. Also these recipes are for 2 or more servings. cooking for 1 will be very trying. There are no pictures of the recipes, so you need a good imagination. She does an excellent job on the Macros breakdown per serving and per batch, including total Carbs and Net Carbs. But for me, this cookbook is anything BUT EASY!
customer_reviews.author: NANCY M.

customer_reviews.title: No pictures of the dishes
customer_reviews.text: Interesting recipes, the yummy picture on the cover sold it, but surprise! Almost no pictures of the finished dishes in the book at all- which was weirdly disappointing, since since I like to see what I’m aiming at when I cook, you know? Does what I made look like what it’s supposed to look like? And the visuals help to get me motivated to cook, all the pretty ‘food porn’ that I look at and say, “ooooh, that one looks delish! I wanna make that!”
customer_reviews.author: NurseDawn

customer_reviews.title: Easy....fast....and mostly common ingredients.
customer_reviews.text: My cookbook arrived yesterday and I already have three things picked out to try. The book is very well written and all the steps are laid out for you...plus the mouth watering photos peak your interest!! I am delighted with my purchase and think you will be too. This will be a welcomeaddition to my cookbook collection.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and affordable keto!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this cookbook for a while and it’s honestly the one we pull out the most. There are so many delicious recipes in here that are both simple to make and affordable. There’s plenty of variety for us, too, with sections for beef, chicken, pork, seafood, sauces, desserts and more. The only thing that doesn’t work for our family is that the majority of recipes are created for 2 people, and we’re a family of three. Not a huge deal. I’m very happy we started keto with this one and it continues to serve us well.
customer_reviews.author: courtneyshea

customer_reviews.title: I dont like this book
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, I should have read more reviews before purchasing. Not only does it not have many easy 5 ingredient recipes, but no pics to see what your going to be making.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: Keto Made Simple
customer_reviews.text: After 5 minutes with this cook book I immediately ordered one delivered to my sister. She was so happy to see that the cook book had a lot of recipes that both her kids will eat. PRO: Easy to read Includes an intro to Keto Gives a great list of Keto pantry must haves (and it is a good list that you end up with the ingredients for a second). Individual serving nutritional facts. One of the greatest pros, the author tells what brands she used and what stores she typical purchases them at.
customer_reviews.author: RockabillyChic

customer_reviews.title: Mislead
customer_reviews.text: While the title of the books makes it seem that all recipes will contain at most 5 ingredients, this is not the case. Most require more the 5 ingredients, making it a dealbreaker for me. I also wanted a vivid photo of at least every other recipe but you hardly get any illustrations. Lastly, most of the ingredients indicated on the recipes and not easily accessible in grocery stores.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: No pictures, too many ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY disappointed in this cookbook. Based of the gorgeous full color cover and the headline touting ease of use, I was expecting a very user friendly cookbook. This was NOT. There are NO pictures inside. Not ONE. SO you have no idea what you are cooking. You just have to trust the title. And unfortunately, despite the claim that these are only 5 ingredients, most are more and many include bizarre ingredients (one I had to order online because I didn't even know what it was). I felt like this was more culinary cuisine than family friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Leighellen's Book Nook

customer_reviews.title: “Easy”-really?  For who?
customer_reviews.text: Need something that is really easy - the ingredients are hard to find and directions are not easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: No pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I like flipping through a cookbook to be inspired by interesting looking recipes. Pictures are an important part of that inspiration. This cookbook has about two pictures that represent the recipes in the book. I don’t want a book full of words.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Recipes read very yummy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm all for pictures in cookbooks, this book only has pictures at the beginning of each chapter. Yesterday I read through most of the recipes to try to imagine how they would look and taste, I found several that I want to try, and one that I actually made, it was really quick, simple and delicious. I would've given it 5 stars if there were pictures of the recipes. About other reviews saying that it's more than 5 ingredients, well, if you count salt, pepper (and other spices as ingredientes), then yes, most are more than 5. They still look very simple.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cueva

customer_reviews.title: Very Disapointing
customer_reviews.text: I though this Keto cookbook would help me with my diet. I found the recipes too much trouble and not varied enough. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: GABADA

customer_reviews.title: Not Real Keto.  Not 5 Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: The total carbs are way too high, especially if you add a "side dish". The small serving size is not given, just half or quarter the final amount. Olive oil (which is a marginally acceptable Keto oil) is recommended almost exclusively. Exogenous ketones are ineffective and can effect the actual production of ketones. The amount of effort required to modify recipies and recalculate macros renders this book completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.text: The recipes are probably fine, but the layout is a bummer via Kindle. No photos inside, lots of dark pull-out boxes that make the text hard to read, and odd things highlighted or in larger fonts, make for a cookbook that's not an enjoyable experience. I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: feffer

customer_reviews.title: Food is visual
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cookbook 2 months ago and haven't made a single recipe even though I've been on the keto diet for these entire 2 months. Why? Because there are ONLY 8 PICTURES IN THIS ENTIRE COOKBOOK!!! 130 recipes and only 8 pictures. When I look through a cookbook, I decide to make something because of how yummy it looks. Of the 8 pictures, only 1 stood out as being special, the rest are smoothies, salads, basic meat and a veggie item that look like I don't need a cookbook to make. I've made a ton of keto meals in the last 2 months and not a single one came from this book. I won't buy her cookbooks again.
customer_reviews.author: Lady person

customer_reviews.title: cook book ?
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this book did not show macro's to help keep track
customer_reviews.author: De H.

customer_reviews.title: Super Simple and Yummy Recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book made keto so easy. It provides keto friendly and budget friendly alternatives to so many meals as well as meals you might not think of. Each recipe is suitable to be prepared by anyone, even beginners with limited experience in the kitchen. I will say, however, that I would not depend on the macros listed in the book and add up the information using your ingredients. There are many recipes that were way off once I added everything up myself-hence the loss of one star.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi F

customer_reviews.title: Ok, I guess.
customer_reviews.text: This book is a good starting point but the nutrition facts are off. And a little confusing....all the recipes say Net Carbs but it doesn't look like they are subtracting fiber, so they are more like Total Carbs. Definitely need to add more seasonings for some of the recipes. I started looking up the same recipes online to get the right Nutrition facts. So it defeats the purpose of the book.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I received this book yesterday and promptly sat down to examine it - I am very pleased and anxious to prepare some of the recipes. Many keto and low carb cookbooks have more detailed recipes and lots of ingredients - I have some of them and I do appreciate the details and work that the authors have done. But I want something fast and easy that gives results without spending a lot of time or tracking down lots of ingredients. These recipes are simple, the macros are supplied and most of them use the same keto or low carb supplies we already have in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: plussizekitty

customer_reviews.title: Great for non-cooks!
customer_reviews.text: Great book for those who want simple easy recipes with just a few ingredients. When I started Keto I didn't want to become a cook! This book helps me keep my life simple!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Z. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Follow with easy to find ingredients.
customer_reviews.text: Most cookbooks use too many, non attainable ingredients. This one is easy to follow and uses ingredients that can be found. I like looking at recipes in a book even though you can get millions online.., a book is easier for me to compare recipes etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book is for people to have a good income otherwise you couldn’t afford to be on
customer_reviews.text: This book would be great if and only if you have a Lotta money because it would be extremely costly to be on this diet. Another words if you don’t have a good income don’t buy this book
customer_reviews.author: robert griffith

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan...
customer_reviews.text: I am with one of the other commenters, I like pictures in my cookbook. Aside from that, the few recipes I have made from here are very bland and many of them are too high in carbs for my strict keto diet. I find a lot better recipes and resources for free online, especially through groups.
customer_reviews.author: Christi-Bee

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: I think that meals are quite complicated to cook and are not practical if only one member of the family follows the keto diet. I plan to return this book.
customer_reviews.author: AMR

customer_reviews.title: Too many carbs per recipe
customer_reviews.text: Half of these recipes are not strict Keto (some recipes have a carb content >20 carbs per serving). I am disappointed in the amount of recipes that included fish and avocado providing little variety. I will be sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J. Vilina

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: We recently started the Keto diet thanks to my in-laws, but we had no idea WHERE to start. After researching cookbooks for Keto, I stumbled on this one. It’s cheap, which I loved, but the book is nicely made. Each recipe is only 5 ingredients and there’s such a wide variety of choices! This book is great for us because we both work and go to school, so there’s not much time to spend prepping/cooking. So far, the recipes we’ve tried have been delicious and our family members keep coming to us for more recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Emilyjk15

customer_reviews.title: Some interesting recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book has a good variety of recipes. I have enjoyed reading through it. The index isn’t very comprehensive, so if you cannot remember the title of a recipe you have to go through the entire index or page through the book. I find it much easier to just do an online search or make up my own recipes. Might be good for someone who doesn’t really know how to cook.
customer_reviews.author: pamela dipzinski

customer_reviews.title: Get This Cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 different keto cookbooks and this was by far the best! The recipes are simple and easy to understand. Plus, this book has ALOT of recipes! Definitely recommend this cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: Dina C

customer_reviews.title: Great book with a variety if recipies
customer_reviews.text: This book is simple with ingredients which I need in my busy life. It has a ton of recipies and the people that are complaining about the 5 ingredients not being EXACTLY 5 ingredients are the people that ask for managers. Usually it's like salt, or pepper added. If you cant get past that then the books not for you, which is a weird thing to not get past.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie M Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This book has some delicious and super easy recipes in it. I returned the first book I got because it didn’t have anything in it we liked- this book is amazing!! I’ve made about 15 things from it so far and loved each one! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: So I received this cookbook yesterday. I started looking through it today to see what I wanted to make and prepare a grocery list. A few page turns in and the pages have already separated from the spine of the book. Many of the recipes sound like they’re going to taste great based on ingredients but I’m not thrilled about having to deal with pages falling out every time I use it. Also there are no pictures of the dishes (except for the start of each section) so nothing to compare to as far as presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes!
customer_reviews.text: I started keto a little over a week ago, and the weight is just falling off of my 62-year-old body at an amazing rate, 8 lbs in my first week! This cookbook is loaded with simple recipes for busy week nights. As with all cookbooks, every recipe isn't right for me. I skip the tomato and cheesy recipes because of food allergies, but there's still lots to work with.
customer_reviews.author: C. Milina

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my son and now I want one too!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cookbook for my son, who has been living a keto lifestyle for almost a year. Nice photos of prepared recipes, great for people to actually see what the dish should look like. Most are super simple, which is wonderful for a busy single dad like my son. He tends to eat the same meals over and over again, so I bought this to give him some ideas about meal possibilities, Now I want one for myself as I start on my own keto journey.
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: 5-ingredient? Really? Ya think?
customer_reviews.text: I might not be too good at math. But I can count to five. And this “5-ingredient” cookbook has missed the mark. Don’t get me wrong, 8 or 12 (yes 12) isn’t much more than 5, but come on. I wanted simple 5-ingredient recipes. Oh well. Maybe they could have claimed it was a dollar then charged ten. Would have fit the business model.
customer_reviews.author: ArcFlash

customer_reviews.title: ... kind of foods I can eat this book is AMAZING. All of the recipes are easy and delicious ...
customer_reviews.text: As a type one diabetic the Keto diet has been a godsend and as a person who doesn’t have any clue how to cook or what kind of foods I can eat this book is AMAZING. All of the recipes are easy and delicious that a person who usually eats microwave dinners can do it! If you want to do the Keto diet, this book will make your life easier. Gives you info about the diet and a long list of foods to eat and foods to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Galen

customer_reviews.title: A decent book
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent book with a number of recipes that did well and some that didn't. Like I have found with every cookbook I have ever bought, there are recipes that interest me and many that don't.... many that do well and many that don't. But I always learn something. In my opinion/experience, that's just the way it is with most cookbooks.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke Sr

customer_reviews.title: I guess its good. Never found out.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend, to be, you know- supportive. I'd gotten her one for paleo too. To be supportive. Now she's on weight-watchers. I'm not buying her one for that. In Maine, I've heard it said that you should get yourself a hefty girlfriend. Warm in the winter. Shade in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: Like reading a BLOG!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much. However I was not expecting to read a blog. There are next to no photos in this book and some recipes call for chemically made sugar replacements...That's not the healthy way to go if you're going KETO. Some of the recipes are good, but I ended up just giving this away. It seems anyone can write a cookbook these days.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas guest

customer_reviews.title: Not easy if you are not a cook
customer_reviews.text: I will say up front, I am not a cook...not even a little bit. So "easy" sounded good...but I found the recipes to be beyond my limited cooking skills.
customer_reviews.author: Greeneyedlady

customer_reviews.title: Great Keto Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I'm no cook but you'd never know it. These recipes are easy and delicious. You'll forget you're on a Keto diet. This is an awesome cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: 50Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: I returned this book.
customer_reviews.text: Nice recipes but some required more than 5 ingredients. I returned this book.
customer_reviews.author: sarinmom2

customer_reviews.title: ... one recipe from this book and it was a great success. My new roommate is on the Ketogenic ...
customer_reviews.text: I've made only one recipe from this book and it was a great success. My new roommate is on the Ketogenic Diet - more so than me. Thought it would help to follow it when we share a meal. The recipe? Beef & Bell Pepper "Potato Skins". Soooo good and the avocado cream? Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Delicious recipes but not ALL KETO
customer_reviews.text: Has some delicious recipes not all dishes take 30 minutes. They don't include the prepping of other ingredients, some things are expected to just be ready.
customer_reviews.author: Philip baca

customer_reviews.title: Great second book for KETO
customer_reviews.text: Not all are 5 ingredients and some recipes assume you have other ingredients available.. but THESE RECIPES ARE CLEAR AND SIMPLE. Keto eating should be simple and easy to make because you are never hungry on Keto so I want food I make to be quick to make. These recipes are such.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Gail Gutierrez-McDermid

customer_reviews.title: easy recipes to follow
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. I don't like that it doesn't have a lot of pictures but the recipes are really simple, easy to follow and few ingredients. I'm new to cooking and this book makes it easy. I've already tried 3 recipes, it's much more than I've ever tried from any cooking book.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Azahar

customer_reviews.title: a gift
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift for a friends whose husband has to have a double lung transplant and he has to eat a high protein diet. she loved it
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Delightful
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for anyone just starting Keto. So many good options especially if you get stuck in a food rut like I do. Most are super easy and ingredients that you either have on hand or things that the grocery store actually carries.
customer_reviews.author: JJohnson

customer_reviews.title: best keto cookbook
customer_reviews.text: this is easy prep and cooking . i get gourmet meals on weeknights, not just weekends. i marinate and get ingredients together the night before so i am ready to cook when i get home. i have cooked quite a few recipes and there are a lot more on the list to try. every one i have cooked, my husband has put on the keeper list. pork chops with blue cheese sauce is delish. tomorrow night--chicken skewers with peanut sauce. i bought 3 keto cookbooks and only found a couple of recupes i liked in each one. this one is the best. i want to try them all.
customer_reviews.author: alak

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I love that the ingredients are easy & pretty much something you can pick up at any regular store. I appreciated that I had majority of the ingredients already listed in this book. I love the glossary too! If you have an ingredient that you want to use, but don't know with what, the glossary lists all the recipes you can make that includes that ingredient. Genius!
customer_reviews.author: Seenzjah

customer_reviews.title: Pictures not needed. Simple and delicious.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little sceptical because the recipes have no pictures but honestly it’s not needed. The recipes are simple and no fuss and taste delish! Received it today and allready made my first meal out of this book. Beware: you will need bacon for most of the recipes. Pictured is garlic butter chicken paired with Brussels sprouts and bacon.
customer_reviews.author: Mic

product_meta.title: The Easy 5-Ingredient Ketogenic Diet Cookbook: Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes for Busy People on the Keto Diet

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
